titles.title: To amend the Federal Reserve Act to require the Vice Chairman for Supervision of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System to provide a written report, and for other purposes.

action.text: Hearings Held by the Subcommittee on Monetary Policy and Trade Prior to Referral.
Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 49 - 0.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 115-980.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 765.

action.text: Mr. Tipton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4753.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary:
Federal Reserve Supervision Testimony Clarification Act
(Sec. 2) This bill amends the Federal Reserve Act to require the Vice Chairman for Supervision of the Federal Reserve Board to provide a written testimony on board efforts regarding the supervision of certain financial institutions. If such position is vacant, another specified representative of the board must testify.
